title: Did David Harbour drop major Stranger Things spoiler in his Instagram profile?
text:
Is Jim alive? (Picture: Netflix)

Stranger Things fans love a conspiracy theory so David Harbour’s recent Instagram profile picture change has definitely got tongues wagging.

The end of season three, of course, saw his Jim Hopper sacrifice himself so that Joyce could close the gate to the Upside Down.

However, it’s long been thought that Hopper is not dead because his body never turned up – and that post-credits scene about ‘The American’ led to more theorising about where Hopper has been and what he has been up to.

Now, Harbour has changed his profile picture to a piece of fan art he originally shared in July which shows Hopper and Eleven hugging

In his profile, however, he has flipped the picture upside down and tiled it so that it now looks like Hopper staring at himself and Eleven hugging.

Is Hopper trapped in the Upside Down after all?

David Harbour’s Instagram picture has fans raising eyebrows (Picture: Instagram)

The trippy Netflix series, which has been renewed for season four, closed with Joyce (played by Winona Ryder) sacrificing Hopper (David Harbour) to spare Hawkins being taken over by the Mind Flayer and the USSR.

Once the credits rolled, we were given another headache as it turned out someone we know only as ‘The American’ is being held captive and will likely be the centre of the story when Stranger Things returns next year.

Now all the signs are pointing to Hopper (or Barb!), but one eagle-eyed fan noticed a hidden message in the title credits which quite literally spells out ‘Hopper is alive’.

Coincidence? Possibly, but showrunners The Duffer Brothers are notorious for leaving trails of telling breadcrumbs in the unlikeliest of places.

Metro.co.uk compiled all the evidence Hopper will be back for season four, and there’s a lot. Stranger Things seasons one to three are available to stream on Netflix.

Season four is expected to drop in 2020.
